data.title: Stoppard's  Arcadia great, like Winter's Tale last Spring
data.text: I'm a Shakespearean, edit books on the Bard for a Swiss publisher: the Gamm's Winter's Tale equaled the London Shakespeare I've seen--oh, 25 plays.  Same now with Stoppard, whom I have seen maybe 8 times in London, once Stoppard's translation of Chekov, when I got the last signed copy--the Director of the Hong Kong Shakespeare Company, right behind me, missed out. And  this  Arcadia I saw twice there, at the Royal Court Theatre.  One time I sat next to a U Cambridge professor, whose history of English Literature I had back in the states on my shelf. This was his third time seeing Arcadia, because he couldn't sort out some of the bifurcatesd history and story.  I too considered the play a conundrum until I saw Director Sullivan's version.  He makes sense of the play--the tutor may have become the Hermit, among other things.  The  young female math genius asks her tutor, "Is God a Newtonian?"  He asks, "AN Etonian?  Without a doubt."

data.title: Disappointed at the Gamm
data.text: I could not be more disappointed with this venue.  I attended an evening production recently and have some suggestions for making the experience more enjoyable: Increase signage so that first timers can easily find the entrance, put some lights in the parking lot for safety, and redesign the exit strategy in case of an emergency.  It appears there are only 2 exits for 137 people. Not enough for my comfort level.  Will not rush back.

data.title: Seriously good theater!
data.text: Just finished my first season subscription and couldn't be more pleased! The venue of around 100 seats puts you quite close to the drama, and with the high quality of stage design, direction, and acting, I repeatedly was "blown away". I already purchased for next season and have convinced a few others to join me. Buy tickets soon, as even my trial season pass for Thursday nights showed nearly sold-out performances.

data.title: Wonderful production of Shakespeare tale!
data.text: My wife and I were given tickets to a production of A Winter's Tale put on by the cast of the Gamm Theater. The cast was outstanding and being one of Shakespeare's lighter tales it had a happy ending. Actor's are real pros, as good as nearby Trinity in Providence.  There are snacks and drinks available at the intermission. It is a cozy little place inside part of an old refurbished national guard armory. Thank you Annie!

data.title: A nice venue
data.text:
We went there for an awards ceremony and fundraiser that included drinks, appetizers, and dinner. 
The servers were very attentive to our needs. The food was delivered hot and the drinks were constantly refilled. 
The presentation was outstanding and wouldn't mind going back there for a show. 
The place was nice, but needed more bathrooms for the amount of people it holds.

data.title: Worth More Than Visiting Just Once
data.text: This theater is small but do not let that keep you from attending a performance. They are celebrating it`s thirty first season this year. The theatre has about 137 seats. However not a bad one in the house. The plays and actors are all first rate. We just saw "A Streetcar Named Desire"  Which was an outstanding production. They even had live music to go along with the play. We try to attend several of the productions a year.

data.title: Small but great venue
data.text: Recently saw Streetcar Name Desire. They have only @6 rows with all great seats.I do not think they even used microphones but could hear everything...Small snack bar with beer and wine..Cast was wonderful and really enjoyed it.

data.title: The Very Essence of Good Live Theater
data.text: Every production I've seen here has been produced with a very high artistic standards. All the incredible things you've read about The Gamm, yes they are true. I couldn't recommend it more strongly.

data.title: High quality all around
data.text: I've seen about a dozen shows here and everything was great, and memorable, even if I'd been a little "iffy" about a show description beforehand. The place is small enough that there's not a bad seat in the house. But big enough to not feel at all claustrophobic. Getting to know the resident company in different roles has been fun. The prices can't be beat for professional, live theater. This place is worth a trip, and I feel very lucky that I really don't HAVE a trip (I live nearby). Parking & refreshments are good also. Give the Gamm a try, you will probably be back!

data.title: a go to venue with plays and actors live. How neat that is.
data.text:
located in an older building but is really nice. they put on some nice shows the seating is small but that is fine. The actors really try hard to put on the best show they can and it shows.
a place to go and have a nice night out.

data.title: Nice little theater
data.text: The theater company always puts on an enjoyable program and for some plays get audience participation. I have always had a good time.

data.title: Great Little Theater
data.text:
The Gamm Theater in Pawtucket was a great surprise. It's a small/intimate setting, but the play we saw (Hedda Gabbler) was excellent. The actors were all experienced professionals - comparable to and in some cases even better than you would find at Trinity Rep in Providence.
They offer a variety of plays year-round, so it is worth checking out.

data.title: nice
data.text: The venue is a smaller theatre and the stadium style seating isn't the most comfortable, but the shows here are always well done and interesting. Can be a bit pricey but we like supporting local talent.

data.title: Shakespeare at its best
data.text: Been attending the Gamm since it was on Elbow street in Providence.  I was hooked on Macbeth with moving and rotating audience seating in the days of Niles.  Tony Estrella does a wonderful job, as did character actors such as Sam Babbitt.  This small theatre group always puts on a great theatric production and chooses varied themes , actors, and scenes that always impress and often are amusing.  A fun and worthwhile way to spend your time.  The theatre's seating gives all a fair view and is semi comfortable.  Hamlet was fantastic

user_location.name: East Providence, Rhode Island, United States

data.title: Little Theater/Big Talent
data.text: This little theater in Pawtucket, Rhode Island is an excellent example of hard work and talent tucked away in the arts section of the city. If you have little children, you should check to see if the play is appropriate. The plays are thought provocking. . .

data.title: The Best
data.text: I have subscribed to every season of The Gamm for the past nine years so it's obvious that I find it outstanding. It's theater with an edge that keeps it refreshing and engaging. All aspects, acting, directing, sets are always the best. Two friends and I come "all the way from Charlestown."

data.title: A great little theater
data.text: This small theater is a true gem.  Due to the size, there is not a bad seat.  The play we saw was really good.  The only problem was the lack of organization at the box office.   The process for will call was slow.  We will be back!

data.title: Another gem of a theater in Rhode Island!
data.text: I love the Gamm Theater in Pawtucket!  I've never seen a production that they've done that isn't incredibly professionally presented.  The actors are talented and passionate about what they do and it's evident in each play.  The latest production, Good People, was as good as anything I've seen in New York--just wonderful.  Buy tickets for anything they do--I'm confident you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Great Play at the Gamm
data.text:
My husband and I had received two tickets to the Gamm Theater from a fundraising auction and decided to pick a play to see.  Years ago I had seen the Santa Diaries there and it was hysterical, so we pulled out the list of shows to see what we could fit into our pre holiday schedule.  With the certificate you need to use it via mail or go to the box office in person.  There are, of course some restrictions as were to be expected.  We took the short drive to the box office and they had two seats available for that night to see "Good People".  My husband had never seen a play there and I told him it I a very small venue - all seats appear to be good seats.  The girl printed out our tickets and we headed home to eat, then head back for the show.  The performance was great - a very funny, moving play that received very good reviews.  You can purchase snacks, water, beer and wine while you are there as well.
I am all for supporting local businesses and venues, and this is one I will certainly return to!  We're keeping our eyes open to see what is playing so we my plan another very enjoyable "date night"  I'd recommend the Gamm to anyone looking for a great experience.

data.title: Great theater
data.text: Performances of the actors are always convincing and effective; intimate venue makes an evening at Gamm a pleasure.
